Good lord. I am watching a documentary on this guy named Chris-Chan and I am legitimately horrified. Like, blood turned to ice, pit in my stomach horrified.
Currently in the midst of the 3rd episode of 11, each one is 30-40 minutes long giving a truly utterly comprehensive analysis of this person as he grew and transformed into what he is now.
It's scary how well put together the series is. There is frankly a flabbergasting amount of information that is being cited here.
Oh I LOVE Chris-chan. What a phenomenon.
How the hell did he get on tv so many times.
It's insane

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9Aiv66DEGjE

oh my god theres 4 parts

oh no oh dear

The level of detail this goes into is sickening.
It boggles the mind
Reading responses he made on his middle school exams. Looking at how he perceived his childhood "gal-pals" that were actually just girls his father paid off to pretend to be friends...
The amount of INFORMATION about him is just...completely absurd.
The suspicious white stain down his jeans on his 18th birthday. The last time he would actually be with his gal-pals.
This shit wants to be on Netflix.
It start off really fucking sad actually. Like, heartrendingly sad to hear how he was raised.

Man, it hurts. Looking at the things he does, you can see how close he was. How he totally could have been a functional contributor to society. If he was just able to differentiate between his imaginations and respect the demands of reality...
Like, there's a spark there for a while. A determination that countless other folks lack that he squanders on blurring the lines of his reality.
Idk. I feel like he was most likely doomed from the get go
Though what did happen was...far  beyond whats nromal
I'm not saying he's a savant or anything, but maybe with a better upbringing...
Going through this, I feel like there's a bit of a self fulfilling prophecy that he cursed himself with.
That he was intelligent enough to know that he was never going to be intelligent, so he never tried and his environment never pushed against that notion.
So he never got past being a junior high kid.
Any time an authority figure challenged him or his actions, mommy and daddy were there to save the day and maintain the status quo.
From the teachers at his schools to the police arresting him for loitering soliciting girlfriends at Walmart, they never let him see consequence.
So he sees his actions as right as he's never conclusively been shown to be wrong.
Therefore the actions of a disorderly 13 year old are just as valid at 35 or however old he is.

I'm having trouble piecing together my thoughts, but from what I see, a huge part of his problems was not the autism itself, it is the unchallenged narcissism. That is not a result of autism, that is a result of nonstop coddling and enabling.
The narcissism was allowed to fester in his mind and became the delusion he lives by.
Autism in and of itself is a helluva handicap, but pair it up with a deeply instilled delusion of society, and you get the hyper-extremes like Chris Chan I think.
He's sort of like a big metaphor for the whole "cultural marxism" thing
The worst of millenials taken to the extreme
He could only exist in our generation
Ever read The Glass Menagerie? 1944 play about a family that lives in various levels of self delusion.
Most prominent of them being the girl with a physical handicap that she ended up forging into a complete inferiority complex and general mental fragility.
So she spends her days with her mother idly chatting and dreaming of all the "gentleman callers" that will one day waltz through their front door.
And when she's not, she's lost in her own little world that shes created with her glass figurines.
she's*

The concept of utterly delusional shut-ins and outcasts unwittingly generated by their family is certainly not a new one. But Chris Chan is probably the closest thing we can achieve to perfect, grand crazy in real life without being literally Norman Bates
Yeah there's tons of lesser examples
See: 4chan
But Chris-chan is the beautiful like...chaos theory-tier disaster
Where the worst possible things for his development occured to him
While at the same time all being public
Between all the times he got on TV and his internet fame...
His slow descent can and has been picked apart and analysed
It's honestly hard to think of him as a real person and not like, a character from something
Perhaps because he legitimately believes he is a part of his character's universe? And everything that he's ever done with Sonicu and pals is just plagarism.
So he's living the life that he identifies with: A series of TV, cartoon, and movie tropes.

Also, my allusion to Norman Bates is a rather unfortunate one. I fear the the possibility of his mother dying from living in their own filth and him being so deep into his own world that he just continues to live as if nothing is wrong is dishearteningly
very real.
I cant even fathom what he must think. I imagine he must fluctuate between levels of lucidity; sometimes believing he's his self-insert, sometimes being aware of reality, and every state inbetween.
Though it's hard for me to accept that someone could be so completely deluded to actually live inside their own fiction
Especially when it's a bizzare smattering of other media mashed together, how does he fill in details like...
So he's still living with his mother in the exact same way?
How has he not been institutionalised
